Package smartgraph.view.graphview

Interface SmartStylableNode

All Known Subinterfaces:
SmartGraphEdge<E,​V>, SmartGraphEdgeBase<E,​V>, SmartGraphVertex<V>
All Known Implementing Classes:
SmartArrow, SmartGraphEdgeCurve, SmartGraphEdgeLine, SmartGraphVertexNode, SmartLabel, SmartStyleProxy
public interface SmartStylableNode
A stylable node can have its css properties changed at runtime.
All Java FX nodes used by SmartGraphPanel to represent graph entities should implement this interface.
See Also:
SmartGraphPanel

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void addStyleClass​(java.lang.String cssClass)
    Applies cumulatively the CSS styling defined in class selector cssClass.
    boolean removeStyleClass​(java.lang.String cssClass)
    Removes a previously cssClass existing CSS styling.
    void setStyle​(java.lang.String css)
    Applies cumulatively the css inline styles to the node.
    void setStyleClass​(java.lang.String cssClass)
    Applies the CSS styling defined in class selector cssClass.

  • Method Details

    • setStyle

      void setStyle​(java.lang.String css)
      Applies cumulatively the css inline styles to the node.

      These inline JavaFX styles have higher priority and are not overwritten by any css classes set by addStyleClass(java.lang.String). But will be discarded if you use setStyleClass(java.lang.String)

      If you need to clear any previously set inline styles, use .setStyle(null)

      Parameters:
      css - styles

    • setStyleClass

      void setStyleClass​(java.lang.String cssClass)
      Applies the CSS styling defined in class selector cssClass.

      The cssClass string must not contain a preceding dot, e.g., "myClass" instead of ".myClass".

      The CSS Class must be defined in smartpgraph.css file or in the custom provided stylesheet.

      The expected behavior is to remove all current styling before applying the class css.

      Parameters:
      cssClass - name of the CSS class.

    • addStyleClass

      void addStyleClass​(java.lang.String cssClass)
      Applies cumulatively the CSS styling defined in class selector cssClass.

      The CSS Class must be defined in smartpgraph.css file or in the custom provided stylesheet.

      The cumulative operation will overwrite any existing styling elements previously defined for previous classes.

      Parameters:
      cssClass - name of the CSS class.

    • removeStyleClass

      boolean removeStyleClass​(java.lang.String cssClass)
      Removes a previously cssClass existing CSS styling.

      Given styles can be added sequentially, the removal of a css class will be a removal that keeps the previous ordering of kept styles.

      Parameters:
      cssClass - name of the CSS class.
      Returns:
      true if successful; false if cssClass wasn't previously set.
